refsynopsisdiv.cmdsynopsis: Export Using Templates - A Griffith's export plugin making use of fully customizable templates

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Make a new directory with the short name 'template/template' family (each dir can contain more then one template, see config.xml description)
Prepare page.tpl file. Page.tpl file should contain three parts:
* header - will appear on top of every generated file
* items - will be filled with data from every exported movie
* tail - will appear at the bottom of files
To split them, add <!-- ITEMS --> string before and <!-- /ITEMS --> string after items part.
Optionaly: make preview images (see CONFIG file section). Best resolution for preview images is 200x150px

refsect1.title: TEMPLATE TAGS
refsect1.para: Bellow are listed the allowed tags in page.tpl files. Every tag name starts with "@" character. Between tags you can put two special strings: @TITLE@ and @DATA@ wich will be replaced with fields (translated if needed) title and movie data.
Example: <@runtime>@TITLE@ field contains "@DATA@" data</@runtime> will be transformed into: Runtime field contains "120 min." data

listitem.para: string defined in "Template" tab, @TITLE@ not used

varlistentry.listitem: name of the poster image file (without path and extension)
name of country, where movie was produced
from this URL was fetched movie's data
URL where movie's trailer can be found
number of discs and disc type, f.e. "2xDVD"

refsect1.title: CONFIG FILE
refsect1.para: The easiest way to create config.xml file is copying it from another template and just editing it. Every file must contain template's author, version and author's email. Optionally you can add description and list of styles. Every style item must contain name and file name. See template.dtd for more details.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLE
refsect1.para: Example template can be found at /usr/share/griffith/export_templates/html_tables dir
